unnormalised: ## Ditch the Cassette: Why Music Streaming is the Raja of Entertainment!
normalised: ## Ditch the Cassette: Why Music Streaming is the Raja of Entertainment!

unnormalised: Remember those days of painstakingly recording songs off the radio onto a cassette tape? Or saving up your pocket money to buy the latest album at Rhythm House in Mumbai? Well, beta, those days are long gone! Music streaming has officially taken over, and frankly, it's no surprise.
normalised: Remember those days of painstakingly recording songs off the radio onto a cassette tape? Or saving up your pocket money to buy the latest album at Rhythm House in Mumbai? Well, beta, those days are long gone! Music streaming has officially taken over, and frankly, it's no surprise.

unnormalised: We're talking instant access to practically *every* song imaginable, right at your fingertips. From A.R. Rahman's iconic scores (think "Dil Se..") to the latest Bollywood bangers and even that obscure ghazal your Dadi loves, it's all there! And the best part? No more scratched CDs or tangled headphone wires!
normalised: We're talking instant access to practically *every* song imaginable, right at your fingertips. From A. R. Rahman's iconic scores (think "Dil Se..") to the latest Bollywood bangers and even that obscure ghazal your Dadi loves, it's all there! And the best part? No more scratched C D's or tangled headphone wires!

unnormalised: Services like Spotify, Apple Music, and Gaana have completely revolutionized how we consume music in India. You can create personalized playlists for every mood – a high-energy one for your commute on the Mumbai local (avoiding the 8:23 am CST local, trust me!) or a chill vibe playlist for relaxing after a long day of lectures at IIT Delhi.
normalised: Services like Spotify, Apple Music, and Gaana have completely revolutionized how we consume music in India. You can create personalized playlists for every mood – a high-energy one for your commute on the Mumbai local (avoiding the eight twenty three a m C S T local, trust me!) or a chill vibe playlist for relaxing after a long day of lectures at I I T Delhi.

unnormalised: But it's not just about convenience. Music streaming has also democratized the music industry. Independent artists can now reach a global audience without relying on big record labels. Remember that awesome indie band you saw at a local cafe in Bangalore? Chances are, you can find their music streaming right now.
normalised: But it's not just about convenience. Music streaming has also democratized the music industry. Independent artists can now reach a global audience without relying on big record labels. Remember that awesome indie band you saw at a local cafe in Bangalore? Chances are, you can find their music streaming right now.

unnormalised: And let's not forget the value for money! Paying a small monthly subscription (usually around Rs. 99 to Rs. 129) gives you unlimited access to millions of songs. Think about how many cassettes you could buy with that amount back in the day! Maybe 2 or 3 max!
normalised: And let's not forget the value for money! Paying a small monthly subscription (usually around rupee ninety nine to rupee one hundred and twenty nine) gives you unlimited access to millions of songs. Think about how many cassettes you could buy with that amount back in the day! Maybe two or three max!

unnormalised: Plus, many platforms offer offline downloads, so you can listen to your favourite tracks even when you're travelling through areas with poor network connectivity, like that road trip you took last year to Ladakh where you didn't have signal for 600 km!
normalised: Plus, many platforms offer offline downloads, so you can listen to your favourite tracks even when you're travelling through areas with poor network connectivity, like that road trip you took last year to Ladakh where you didn't have signal for six hundred kilometer!

unnormalised: So, whether you're a seasoned music aficionado or just looking for something to listen to while you cook your dal, give music streaming a try. You might just find your new favourite artist or rediscover a classic you’d forgotten. Trust me, it's the future of entertainment, and it's here to stay.
normalised: So, whether you're a seasoned music aficionado or just looking for something to listen to while you cook your dal, give music streaming a try. You might just find your new favourite artist or rediscover a classic you’d forgotten. Trust me, it's the future of entertainment, and it's here to stay.
